full_summary:
**Tender Announcement: Aerological Observations at Prince George Upper Air Station**

**Reference:** cb-5209-98803883

**Public Notice Date:** May 3, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** June 12, 2023, at 6:00 PM
**Contract Period:** July 1, 2023, to June 30, 2025, with an option for renewal for three one-year periods

**Description:**
The Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) requires the services of a contractor to provide aerological observations at the Prince George Upper Air Station, British Columbia. The contractor will be responsible for conducting two upper air soundings per day, 365 days a year (366 in a leap year), to monitor temperature, humidity, wind, and wind shear data.

**Scope of Work:**
The contractor will be required to:

* Prepare instruments for soundings
* Conduct upper air soundings
* Monitor data and messages produced by the instruments
* Ensure the prompt transmittal of data onsite at the upper air station

**Key Requirements:**
* Experience in conducting upper air soundings
* Familiarity with meteorological data transmission equipment
* Ability to work independently and make decisions in a timely manner

**Trade Agreement:**
This tender is open to contractors who can supply services from Canada and across the following trade agreements: Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA).

**Bid Solicitation:**
The bid solicitation documents can be found on the Canada Buys website at: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/5209/5000068215-rfp-en-canadabuys_0.pdf
